simplified:
Now NASA is trying to find and record smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 meters wide or bigger. Scientists think there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, they have found and recorded about 8,000 of them. This means 17,000 asteroids are still missing. 

In 2013, a small asteroid exploded above a city called Chelyabinsk in Russia. This asteroid was only 19 meters wide. It hurt 1,200 people. The asteroids that NASA is looking for are much bigger than this one. If these bigger asteroids come close to Earth, they would be very dangerous.

Complex Document: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:

simplified: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol makes them to show the districts they are still being punished for fighting against the government. Each year, one boy and one girl between 12 and 18 years old are picked from each district. Their names are chosen by chance, like a lottery. These young people must fight each other until only one person is left alive. The teenagers who are chosen are called "tributes". Everyone in the country must watch this on TV.

simplified: Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects are easy to see in many cities and towns. But in recent years, newspapers around the world have written many stories about wild animals coming into cities. More and more wild animals are coming to cities now. There have been bears in parks in Vancouver. There have been leopards on the streets of Mumbai. There have been wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when big animals come into our cities? Do people want them there? Or do people think they are dangerous or a problem?

simplified: 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are space rocks that can come close to Earth. They can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these dangerous space rocks. None of them will hit Earth in the next 100 years. NASA has technology that can watch these space rocks. They can guess if one might hit Earth. If this happens, NASA has two ways to protect Earth.

Complex Document: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. simplified: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was changing TV channels. At that time, the US was fighting a war in Iraq. She could only find two types of TV shows. One type was reality shows where young people tried to win one million dollars. The other type was news shows about the war. Suzanne says these two things mixed together in her mind in a scary way. This gave her the idea for The Hunger Games.

simplified: The Life of Pi is a story about Pi, a teenager from India. His ship sinks in the ocean. He gets stuck on a small boat in the Pacific Ocean with a dangerous tiger. A Canadian writer named Yann Martel wrote this book. It was his third book. The book came out in 2001. Many people bought it - more than seven million people around the world. The book won many prizes. People translated it into 41 different languages. Martel's father worked for the government in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

Complex Document: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

Complex Document: Dreams of a phone call from an old friend or the death of someone close, for example, are more likely to be the result of coincidence than prophecy. And, of course, we probably choose to forget all the times we dream about such events but they don't happen.

simplified: Some bridges fall down for reasons that are not clear at first. Engineers need to study the bridge carefully to find out why it happened. Sometimes this happens because the materials used to build the bridge were not good quality. Sometimes there was a problem with an important part of the bridge. Other times, the bridge was made to carry only a certain amount of weight, and too much weight was put on it.

Complex Document: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. simplified: I used to work five days every week. But after I had a baby and took time off, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children. I wanted to be with them before they go to school. I talked to my boss about this. We agreed that I would work only three days each week. This meant I would get less money too. My pay went down because I work fewer days. But I saw a problem. My work did not become less! I still have the same amount of work to do. Now I do five days of work in only three days. But I get much less money for it!
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it! 
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: I used to work five days every week. But after I had a baby and took time off, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children. I wanted to be with them before they go to school. I talked to my boss about this. We agreed that I would work only three days each week. This meant I would get less money too. My pay went down because I work fewer days. But I saw a problem. My work did not become less! I still have the same amount of work to do. Now I do five days of work in only three days. But I get much less money for it!

raw_model_output: I used to work five days every week. After I took time off to be with my new baby, I came back to work. I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they go to school. I talked to my boss about this. We agreed that I could work only three days a week instead of five days. This meant I would get much less money because I work fewer days. But I found a problem. I still have the same amount of work to do! Now I do the same work as before, but in only three days. I work the same amount but get much less money for it!

simplified:
Today, many businesses work with people from other countries. Most business people use English to talk to each other. But people from different cultures have different ways of doing business. They have different rules about how to be polite and how to communicate.

If we don't understand these cultural differences, we might make mistakes. We might think bad things about people that are not true. We might not understand each other well. This can cause problems when we try to work together.

Here are three important differences in business manners around the world. These tips can help you when you work with someone from a different culture.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.

simplified:
Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we can see the first signs that early humans were becoming more civilized. We know this because of cave paintings they made. But no one knows how this connects to language. 

People's brains did not suddenly become bigger during this time. However, humans did become smarter and could do more complex things. 

We do not know why this happened. Did using language help their brains grow and develop? Or did their brains become better first, and then they started to create language? No one is sure about the answer.

Complex Document: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

simplified: Many big supermarket companies have been criticized for doing bad things in the last ten years. They have thrown away tons of food. They have paid their suppliers too little money. They have used too much plastic in their packaging. This has hurt our environment. But supermarkets and food stores are now starting to pay attention to these problems. More and more customers are angry about the large amounts of plastic waste from plastic packaging. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have agreed to a plan. They promise to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

Complex Document: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.

They promise to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

simplified:
When Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl, she saw a foreign child playing with a hula hoop in Bangladesh. Wasfia wanted to play too, but she could only watch. In her country, people believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia is older and does amazing things. She climbed the Seven Summits - these are the highest mountains on each continent, like Everest and Kilimanjaro. Very few people in the world have done this. Wasfia also did something special - she played with a hula hoop on top of each mountain. She was the first person to do this.

Why did she do this? She wanted to help women and girls in her country. In Bangladesh, many people think women and girls should not do sports. Wasfia wants to change this and make women feel stronger and more confident.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport.

raw_model_output:

Why did she do this? She wanted to help women and girls in her country. In Bangladesh, many people think women and girls should not do sports. Wasfia wants to change this and make women feel stronger and more confident.

simplified:
We looked at the problems and found some answers. We think Girox Foods should care more about their workers. Here are some ideas:

- Give workers more flexible hours. This means they can choose when to start and finish work.
- Let workers work from home or other places they like.
- Managers should give workers interesting tasks and say "good job" when they do well.
- The company should spend money to help workers learn new skills. Workers need to learn how to talk better with different people.

These changes will make workers happy. When workers are happy, they do better work.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:
We looked at the problems and found some answers. We think Girox Foods should care more about their workers. Here are some ideas:

- Give workers more flexible hours. This means they can choose when to start and finish work.
- Let workers work from home or other places they like.
- Managers should give workers interesting tasks and say "good job" when they do well.
- The company should spend money to help workers learn new skills. Workers need to learn how to talk better with different people.

These changes will make workers happy. When workers are happy, they do better work.

simplified: Based on what we found, we suggest that Girox Foods should focus more on people when managing the company. We should look for ways to give employees more flexible work hours. We should also think about letting employees work from places they choose. Managers need to find different ways to make work interesting for staff. They should give more positive feedback and recognize the good work that employees do. The company should spend more money on training programs. These programs should focus on social skills and communication between different cultures. This will help create a good workplace where employees can do their best work.

simplified: In the last 200 years, better technology and healthcare helped more children live longer. This caused the world's population to grow very fast. Big families had many children, and most of these children lived to become adults and had their own children. But in the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. Because of this, women around the world started having fewer babies. The average number went down from six babies per woman to only two babies per woman.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.

Because of this, women around the world started having fewer babies. The average number went down from six babies per woman to only two babies per woman.

simplified:
Knowing about different expectations and behavior can help us avoid misunderstanding each other. But we must remember that cultural stereotypes can hurt business relationships. 

National cultures may change how we behave and think. But many other things also influence us. These include where we live, what groups we join, our age, if we are male or female, our company culture, and our personal life experiences.

We should keep knowledge about cultural differences in our minds. But we should not use this knowledge to put all people from one country into the same group. Each person is different.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.

We should keep knowledge about cultural differences in our minds. But we should not use this knowledge to put all people from one country into the same group. Each person is different.

simplified: Springsteen is different from many other famous music artists. He is still making very popular new music that fills big stadiums. He is in his late 60s but still at his best. This does not surprise me. He is a man who tells us important stories about our lives. When you listen to his album "Born in the USA," these stories are still important today, just like they were before.

simplified: Scientists want to know how our genes affect our brains and language. Are there genes that changed and gave us the ability to speak? Scientists found a gene that changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene seems to help with speaking and how our brains control our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change like ours did. We don't know yet how much genes affect language, but maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.

Complex Document: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

raw_model_output: Scientists want to know how our genes affect our brains and language. Are there genes that changed and gave us the ability to speak? Scientists found a gene that changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene seems to help with speaking and how our brains control our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change like ours did. We don't know yet how much genes affect language, but maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.

Scientists found that a gene changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This change seems to help with speaking and how our brains control our mouth and face muscles. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change in the same way. We don't know yet how much genes affect language, but one day we might find the answers by studying our DNA.

Complex Document: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

simplified: Julie Wong is a top scientist who studies robots and computers that think like humans. She has written more than 50 research papers that other scientists have read and approved. These papers were printed in important science magazines. She often gives talks at big meetings around the world. In 2012, she got a special prize called the Royal Academy Simone Fielding fellowship. This prize is very hard to get. Julie lives with her family in a high-tech house that she built herself.
